alert.note: Alert for Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 04 at 8:20PM EDT until August 04 at 9:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DECATUR...MILLER...SOUTHWESTERN MITCHELL... SOUTHWESTERN BAKER...SOUTHEASTERN EARLY AND NORTHERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 820 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Donalsonville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Mesonet. An Ambient Weather Station near Donalsonville measured a wind gust of 68 mph. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Bainbridge, Donalsonville, West Bainbridge, Centerville, Iron City, Climax, Brinson, Jakin, Hanover, Ausmac, Babcock, Little Hope, Mayhaw, Decatur Co A/P, Boykin, Riverturn, Mimsville, Sharphagen and Donaldsonville A/P. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Tallahassee.
